entities.name: harry
entities.description: The main character of the story, being targeted by a rogue Bludger.

entities.name: oliver
entities.description: A person who is also being targeted by the rogue Bludger.

entities.name: george
entities.description: One of the Weasley twins, accusing someone of fixing the Bludgers.

entities.name: madam hooch
entities.description: The teacher in charge of Quidditch practice, mentioned as having locked away the Bludgers.

entities.name: wood
entities.description: The Quidditch coach, expressing anxiety and concern for Harry's safety.

entities.name: slytherins
entities.description: A rival team in the Quidditch game, suspected of tampering with the Bludgers.

entities.name: bludgers
entities.description: The balls used in Quidditch, mentioned as being locked away by Madam Hooch.

entities.name: weasleys
entities.description: A family of wizards, including Fred and George, who are part of the Gryffindor team.

entities.name: fred
entities.description: One of the Weasley twins, warning Harry about the rogue Bludger.

entities.name: alicia spinnet
entities.description: A member of the Gryffindor team, expressing anger and frustration at the situation.

relationships.description: The rogue Bludger is targeting Harry.
The rogue Bludger is also targeting Oliver.
George suspects the Slytherin team of tampering with the Bludgers.
Wood reports to Madam Hooch about the situation.
Harry is advised by Fred and George, who are part of the Weasley family.
